result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovontae K Hamilton-Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovontae K Hamilton-Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Jovontae K Hamilton-Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. State filed a joinder motion. Defense does not object. Court GRANTS joinder in cases 21CM3517 and 22CM1794. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/7/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Jovontae K Hamilton-Brown in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER - ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (7/21/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.N.C.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jovontae K Hamilton-Brown in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl friend of the court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
